turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about SS Ben-my-Chree (1908).
turn.1: What kind of lifeboats were on board SS Ben-my-Chree (1908)?
turn.2: "Ben-my-Chree" was fitted with a total of 12 lifeboats, ten of which were of a large capacity, and each boat was fitted with a patent disengaging gear.
turn.3: How many passengers could fit in one of the lifeboats?
turn.4: She was certified for a crew complement of 116, and had a passenger capacity of 2,700.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: A powerful steam windlass was situated forward on the shelter deck for working the anchors, which were arranged to be stowed in hawse pipes, and two large capstans were fitted aft on the shelter deck for warping purposes.
turn.7: Was there anything else located on the shelter deck?
turn.8: A combined steam and hand steering engine was also located aft, and this was controlled by a telemotor gear from the navigating bridge.
turn.9: What was the purpose of the telemotor gear?
turn.10: There was also a powerful steering gear situated forward, the purpose of which was to operate a bow rudder so as to facilitate the quick turning and manoeuvring of the vessel when entering or leaving port.
turn.11: What other steering methods were used?
turn.12: For the stern rudder there was a combined steam and hand gear.
